item.title: Mortal Kombat 1 DLC character T-1000 launches March 18 for Kombat Pack 2 owners, March 25 for all
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/mortal-kombat-1-dlc-character-t-1000-launches-march-18-for-kombat-pack-2-owners-march-25-for-all

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Madam Bo to appear as Kameo Fighter.

Mortal Kombat 1 downloadable content character T-1000 will launch on March 18 for Kombat Pack 2 / “Khaos Reigns” expansion owners and March 25 for all users, publisher Warner Bros. Games and developer NetherRealm Studios announced.

Get the latest details below.

Featuring the voice and likeness of actor Robert Patrick, the liquid metal-based cybernetic assassin from the Terminator 2: Judgment Day (1991) film utilizes a deadly moveset allowing the advanced prototype to shapeshift and organically form stabbing weapons. The T-1000 will join the Mortal Kombat 1 roster on March 18 as part of the early access period for Mortal Kombat 1: Khaos Reigns Expansion owners, followed by wide availability for purchase on March 25.

The video also shows off a glimpse of Madam Bo, a new downloadable content Kameo Fighter who can assist during matches with a range of support moves. The Madam Bo Kameo Fighter will be available as a content update for all Mortal Kombat 1: Khaos Reigns owners at no additional cost or via standalone purchase on March 18.

The new trailer was debuted at Pro Kompetition Mexico, the opening event for the Mortal Kombat 1 Pro Kompetition: Season 2, hosted in Mexico City. The new season of the global esports program featuring Mortal Kombat 1 features a $255,000 USD total prize pool with a variety of live, in-person events across North America, Latin America, South America, and Europe, as well as multiple online tournaments. For more information or to register for an event, visit the online hub.

Mortal Kombat 1: Khaos Reigns is a new expansion for Mortal Kombat 1, the latest installment in the acclaimed Mortal Kombat videogame franchise developed by award-winning NetherRealm Studios. Mortal Kombat 1: Khaos Reigns is available now digitally for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, the Nintendo Switch, and PC (Steam and Epic Games Store), including a story expansion with playable fighters Cyrax, Sektor, Noob Saibot, Ghostface, Conan the Barbarian, and T-1000 Terminator (March 18), along with Madam Bo Kameo Fighter (March 18).

Mortal Kombat 1 is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store.

Watch a new trailer below.

DLC Character T-1000 First Look Trailer

item.title: This Week’s Japanese Game Releases: Monster Hunter Wilds, Yu-Gi-Oh! Early Days Collection, more
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/this-weeks-japanese-game-releases-monster-hunter-wilds-yu-gi-oh-early-days-collection-more

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Cladun X3, Glover and Ninja Five-O re-releases, etc.

Monster Hunter Wilds for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC, and Yu-Gi-Oh! Early Days Collection for Switch and PC are the highlights of this week’s Japanese video game releases.

Get the full list of this week’s Japanese game releases below. It should be noted that Gematsu will receive a small percentage of money from purchases made through Play-Asia links. You can also save five percent with our multi-use “GEMATSU2025” coupon code.

Hardware

  • PlayStation 5 Monster Hunter Wilds Bundle
  • PlayStation 5 Digital Edition Monster Hunter Wilds Bundle
  • DualSense Wireless Controller Monster Hunter Wilds Limited Edition
  • PlayStation 5 Console Cover Monster Hunter Wilds Limited Edition

Physical and Digital

  • Cladun X3 (PS5, PS4, Switch)
  • CRYSTAR (PS5) – Already available digitally worldwide.
  • Fuyuzono Sacrifice (Switch)
    • Limited Edition (Switch)
  • The medical examination diary: Teamwork in Paradise. (Switch)
    • Limited Edition (Switch)
  • Monster Hunter Wilds (PS5) – Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version
      • Standard Edition (PS5, Xbox Series)
      • SteelBook Edition (PS5, Xbox Series)
    • European Version (PS5, Xbox Series)
    • Asian Version
      • Standard Edition (PS5, Xbox Series, PC)
      • SteelBook Edition (PS5)
      • e-Capcom Set (PS5)
        • Without Game (PS5)
  • Okayu Nyumu! Limited Edition (Switch, PC)
  • Re;quartz Reido (Switch)
    • Limited Edition (Switch)
  • Utawarerumono Trilogy Set (Switch)
  • Wizardry: The Five Ordeals (Switch) – Already available digitally worldwide.
    • Collector’s Edition (Switch)
  • Yu-Gi-Oh! Early Days Collection (Switch) – Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version (Switch)
    • European Version (Switch)
    • Asian Version (Switch)

Digital-Only

  • Crowns and Pawns: Kingdom of Deceit (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One) – Launching worldwide.
  • Glover (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, Switch) – Launching worldwide.
  • Him, the Smile & bloom (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
    • Switch version also launching in the west.
  • The medical examination diary: Teamwork in Paradise. (PC [Steam])
  • Monster Hunter Wilds (Xbox Series, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Ninja Five-O (PS5, PS4, Switch, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Okayu Nyumu! (PS4, Switch, PC)
  • OMEGA 6: The Triangle Stars (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
    • Switch version also launching in the west.
  • Spectre Divide (PS5, Xbox Series) – Launching worldwide.
  • Yu-Gi-Oh! Early Days Collection (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.

Demos, Betas, Updates, etc.

  • Demon Tides Demo (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Dragon Ball: The Breakers Season 8 Update (PS4, Xbox One, Switch, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes Story Expansion: “The Chapter of Marisa” (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, Switch, PC [Steam, Epic Games Store, GOG]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Granblue Fantasy Versus: Rising Downloadable Content Character Sandalphon (PS5, PS4, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Guns Undarkness Demo (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Honkai: Star Rail Version 3.1 Update “Light Slips the Gate, Shadow Greets the Throne” (PS5, PC [Epic Games Store], iOS, Android) – Launching worldwide.
  • Rise of Rebellion Demo (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Splitgate 2 Open Alpha Test (PS5, Xbox Series, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Type-NOISE: Shonen Shojo Demo (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Under Night In-Birth II Sys:Celes Downloadable Content Character Ogre (Switch) – Launching worldwide.

The PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and Switch titles listed above can be purchased through Japanese PlayStation Network and Nintendo accounts using prepaid cards:

  • PlayStation Store cards (yen): 1,100 / 3,000 / 5,000 / 10,000
  • Nintendo eShop cards (yen): 1,000 / 1,500 / 3,000 / 5,000 / 9,000

item.title: KinnikuNeko: SUPER MUSCLE CAT for PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, and Switch launches March 19
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/kinnikuneko-super-muscle-cat-for-ps5-xbox-series-ps4-xbox-one-and-switch-launches-march-19

  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Console versions of muscular cat platformer dated.

Side-scrolling platformer KinnikuNeko: SUPER MUSCLE CAT will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and Switch on March 19 for $17.99, publisher Mameshiba Games and developer Kamotachi announced. Wishlisting is available now via PlayStation Store, Microsoft Store, and Nintendo eShop.

KinnikuNeko: SUPER MUSCLE CAT first launched for PC via Steam on March 19, 2024.

The console release will be accompanied by a major update for the PC version, which adds full voice-overs in English, Japanese, and Spanish, significantly improves levels and visual effects, improves accessibility, and fixes various bugs.

Here is an overview of the game, via Kamotachi:

About

Wait… A muscular cat that fights aliens!?

Get ready to enjoy this crazy 2D platformer adventure starring KinnikuNeko! A cat with the body of a bodybuilder who will fight against a big alien army that has invaded planet Earth and captured all its inhabitants. He will be accompanied by his friends Lemon and Keita, who haven’t yet been captured by the evil beings from outer space.

  • Fun 2D platformer with different mini-games that will change the rhythm of the game. Purr like a kitty or punch with the strength of a school bus.
  • Exciting story full of goofy humor, friendship, drama and action. Full of charismatic and unforgettable characters.
  • Striking visual style that pays tribute to Japanese anime of the 90s.
  • Awesome soundtrack that will empower your journey.
  • Discover all the secrets by replaying the levels and finding the hidden objects.
  • Meow meow meow meoooow (meow with a button).

Go through different levels using just your muscles to fight, or climbing like a kitty until you find the way to save humanity.

Watch out! The sleek and ferocious General Pitaya, together with her two minions, will not make it easy for you!

Discover the intentions of this evil civilization in a story full of humor, friendship, drama, and action. All under a visual aesthetic typical of 90s Japanese anime and traditional animation!

Why did the aliens decide to invade Earth? Why did they capture all the humans? What brought them here? But the biggest question… A muscular cat?!

Watch a new trailer below.

Consoles Trailer

item.title: NieR series 15th anniversary live stream set for April 19
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/nier-series-15th-anniversary-live-stream-set-for-april-19

What news will the series' latest major milestone bring?

Square Enix will host the NieR series 15th anniversary live stream on April 19 at 18:00 JST, the company announced. You will be able to watch it on YouTube and Niconico.

The broadcast will feature the latest information concerning events and merchandise in celebration of the NieR series’ 15th anniversary, a discussion between developers, and a mini concert.

Presenters include Hiroki Yasumoto (Pod 042 / Grimoire Weiss voice actor), Yosuke Saito (NieR series producer), Yoko Taro (NieR series creative director), Keiichi Okabe (NieR series composer), Takahisa Taura (NieR: Automata senior game designer), Shotaro Seo (pianist), and Takanori Goto (guitarist).

The last major NieR series anniversary live stream, the 10th anniversary, featured the announcement of NieR Replicant ver.1.22474487139…, which was not teased in advance.
